title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: ITPL opens greenfield bitumen derivatives plant near Chennai
items.summary:
- *ITPL*, a JV between IndianOil and TotalEnergies, inaugurated a greenfield Bitumen Derivatives Plant near Chennai.
- The facility will produce *PMB*, *CRMB*, *NRMB*, and bitumen emulsions to support highways and infrastructure across southern India.
- It aims to strengthen supply chains for *NHAI* and state highway programs with materials engineered for local climatic and traffic conditions.

items.title: Google's AI chip push spurs hope for Samsung, SK Hynix
Amazon staff warn AI push harming workforce and planet
items.summary:
- Over a thousand Amazon employees signed an open letter to CEO Andy Jassy warning that the rush into *AI* could harm the climate and workers' futures.
- The letter criticizes Amazon's climate plan and argues that the push to deploy *AI* data centers risks dirty energy and undermines *net-zero* commitments.
- The letter outlines three demands: *No AI with dirty energy*, *No AI without employee voices*, and *No AI for violence, surveillance, or mass deportation*.

items.title: India puts data sovereignty and chip self-reliance at core of expanding space push: Ex-ISRO Chief
Himadri HSCL's first liquid coal tar pitch export
items.summary:
- HSCL completed its first export of *liquid coal tar pitch* from the *New Mangalore Port*, shipping 3,600 tonnes to the Middle East.
- The shipment adds a second export route beside *Haldia*, boosting HSCL's reach in *international markets* across the Middle East and the Americas.
- HSCL plans further expansion with capacity planning, export corridor development, and enhanced port utilisation.

items.title: Sterling & Wilson wins ₹1,381 cr orders from Adani Green
items.summary:
- SWREL signed a five-year strategic partnership with **Adani Green Energy** and won the first purchase order for BOS on three solar projects at *Khavda Renewable Energy Park*, worth about ₹1,381 crore.
- With this win, SWREL has now achieved more than ₹6,450 crore of order inflows this financial year, and its pipeline remains robust.
- SWREL is currently executing about *6 GW* in the Khavda region, with *5 GW* scheduled for completion this financial year.

items.title: Shri Keshav Cements expands capacity to 1 MTPA
items.summary:
- Shri Keshav Cements & Infra has expanded capacity to reach **1 MTPA** of cement production. 
- Commercial operations at the expanded plant began on *Nov 29, 2025*, underscoring demand from infrastructure and housing. 
- The firm runs two Karnataka plants at 1,100 TPD with a **40 MW solar portfolio**, using 14 MW internally and exporting 26 MW to markets like North Karnataka, Coastal Karnataka, Goa and Maharashtra.

items.title: Pilibhit sugarcane dept adopts solar power mandate
items.summary:
- *Cane Commissioner Ministhy S* has mandated solar installations across Pilibhit's sugarcane department offices, cooperative societies, and sugar mills to boost *energy self-reliance* and cut emissions.
- The directive, issued after a meeting with *NEDA*, aims to reduce dependence on the *UP Power Corporation* and lower electricity costs while promoting environmental balance.
- Regional officials are to expedite installations at sugarcane research institutes, hospitals, degree colleges, and other department-linked facilities.

items.title: Manufacturing weakens in Europe, Asia on faltering demand and tariff uncertainties
Power, mining, manufacturing drag IIP growth to over one-year low of 0.4% in October
items.summary:
- The *IIP* growth slowed to *0.4%* in *October 2025*, dragged by weak *power*, *mining*, and *manufacturing* sectors.
- The NSO revised September 2025 growth to *4.6%*, while *manufacturing* output in October 2025 rose only *1.8%* YoY (vs *4.4%* a year ago).
- Power output fell *6.9%*, mining fell *1.8%*, and April–October FY26 IIP decelerated by *2.7%* from a year earlier.

items.title: NBC Bearings crackdown on counterfeits in Delhi and Bengaluru
items.summary:
- NBC Bearings' enforcement in Delhi and Bengaluru under its *anti-counterfeiting programme* led to seizures worth over ₹2 crore of counterfeit NBC-branded goods. 
- Raids in Delhi's Gali Rajan Kalan and Kashmere Gate and Bengaluru's JC Road recovered fake bearings, packaging, dies and a laser-marking machine used to forge codes. 
- NEI emphasizes *zero tolerance* toward counterfeit bearings, urges customers to buy from authorised dealers and use the NBC Connect app to verify authenticity while strengthening anti-counterfeiting measures.

items.title: Envision Energy bags 300 MW wind order from UPC Renewables
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- *Envision Energy India* has secured a **300 MW** order from *UPC Renewables India* for 60 wind turbine generators to be deployed in **Karnataka**, delivering ~**900 million units annually**.
- *The first 20 turbines (100 MW)* will be delivered early next year for a project tied to a **100 MW PPA** with *SJVN*, beginning in January 2027.
- *Alok Nigam* of UPC Renewables says the milestone will boost Karnataka's wind capacity toward **500+ MW** in three years, while Envision notes higher output than the **3.3 MW** model with fewer land parcels.

items.title: Industrial production slows to 0.4 per cent in October
items.summary: - India's *IIP* slowed to 0.4% in October, down from 4% in September.\n- The dip comes amid festivals and fewer working days, with *mining* and *electricity* output down about 1.8%.\n- Manufacturing rose 1.8%, and April-October shows *manufacturing* up 3.9% while *mining* fell 1.9%; the *eight core industries* (40% of IIP) remain a key driver.

items.title: MIC Electronics bags SCR passenger-info upgrade
items.summary: - The project will install an *Integrated Passenger Information System* (*IPIS*) at Annavaram and Yelamanchili, with *LED display boards*, clocks and GPS-based updates.\n- An *IP architecture* linked via optical fibre enables fast, central monitoring and secure, energy-efficient displays.\n- Completion is planned in 12 months with a 3-year warranty, adding to MIC Electronics’ footprint at over 200 stations.

items.title: Wockhardt soars after FDA NDA acceptance for new antibiotic
items.summary:
- The US FDA has accepted Wockhardt's NDA for Zaynich, a *first-in-class antibiotic* targeting *Gram-negative infections*, with a **Fast Track** designation.
- Wockhardt's shares rose as much as **12%**, trading near ₹1,386 after the news, marking a historic milestone for the Indian pharma industry.
- Zaynich uses a novel *β-lactam enhancer mechanism* and has drawn global attention for efficacy against difficult pathogens, including compassionate use in India and the US.

items.title: South Korea November exports beat forecasts, led by chips and autos
Su-57 jets, S-500 shield in focus: India likely to pitch mega arms deal with Russia during Putin visit
India PMI at nine-month low of 56.6 in November
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - The **PMI** fell to 56.6 in November, its slowest pace since February, signaling expansion but slower growth.\n- Delays in project starts, market uncertainty and competition restrained orders, while overseas demand growth cooled and input-cost inflation eased to a **nine-month low**.\n- Business sentiment weakened, with future output at its lowest in nearly three-and-a-half years amid tariff concerns and fading GST boosts.

items.title: US benefited immensely from talented Indians: Elon Musk
PM Modi flags need for ‘delivery, not drama’ as winter session begins with 13 key Bills on agenda
CII urges holistic green transition to drive finance, circularity and sustainable infrastructure
Avaada says every state has execution challenges, more bullish on Maharashtra
Tariff framework in focus as government moves to open nuclear power to private sector
India's aviation sector poised for major expansion: Union Minister Jitendra Singh
Rare earth magnet sops to lift India’s EV, chip plans: Industry
Spacetech startups say next two years critical for commercialisation
Rising input costs threaten aluminium manufacturing
items.summary: - The study by *CUTS International* says the current import duty structure keeps domestic *aluminium prices* higher than global norms, constraining *MSMEs*.\n- It notes that lower import barriers could benefit sectors like *construction*, *renewables*, *EVs*, and *electronics* that need substantial aluminium inputs.\n- It calls for rationalising duties to unleash the aluminium value chain, boosting employment and exports from states like *Odisha* and *Tamil Nadu*.

items.title: e-Toys lab inaugurated during convocation of 2nd batch of young engineers trained under MeitY
"New thinking, innovation, youth power": PM Modi lauds Gen Zs attempting to fly drones in Mars-like conditions
Industry hails ₹4,500 cr to modernise SCL Mohali
items.summary:
- **IESA** applauds Rs 4,500 crore to modernise **Semiconductor Complex Limited (SCL)** Mohali, enabling *pilot production* and prototyping. 
- SCL will upgrade to an 180 nm node with 100x capacity gains and potential future moves to smaller nodes, aiding **defence** and **space** sectors. 
- The project aims to turn SCL into a national training centre with *EDA tools* and industry–academia collaboration to grow India's semiconductor talent.

items.title: Nexperia accused by parent Wingtech and Chinese unit of plotting to move supply chain
India's smartphone exports to US fall 36% on tariffs
items.summary:
- GTRI attributes a 36% drop in US smartphone imports from India to steep US tariff hikes that rose to 50% by August.
- Smartphone shipments slipped from about $2.29B in May to $1.50B in October 2025, a loss near $790M.
- Labour-intensive sectors, hit by 50% tariffs, showed the steepest declines, while tariff-exempt items partly cushioned October exports.

items.title: Warangal RMU on track for 2026 completion
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- *Union Coal Minister G Kishan Reddy* said the RMU at Warangal is on track for completion next year, calling it a **game-changing** project.
- Spread over 160 acres, the first phase involves ₹521 crore and will manufacture *MEMU* rakes of 16–20 cars to boost short- and medium-distance travel.
- The RMU is expected to strengthen the *railway sector*, generate large-scale **employment** for Warangal's youth, and boost ancillary industries in the region.

items.title: China's factory activity shrinks again in November, services cool
India in 2047 will be superpower: Ex-ISRO chief Somnath
items.summary:
- Former *ISRO* Chairman **S Somnath** said India will be a **superpower** by 2047, driven by space tech and manufacturing.
- He spoke at ABVP convention, stressing that *science and spirituality* can coexist within a democratic framework.
- He highlighted Chandrayaan-3 and Aditya-L1 milestones and noted private roles in **nuclear** and **green tech** for youth.

items.title: India’s exports to the US down 28.5% in last 5 months as tariffs troubles kick in
Retrofitting legacy machines: India’s strategic advantage in race to smart manufacturing
HAL says order book tops ₹2 lakh crore amid focus on indigenous defence manufacturing at National Security Summit
EFTA bloc to invest $100B in India: innovation
items.author: ANI
items.summary:
- The four-nation *EFTA* bloc pledged to invest $100 billion in India for *innovation* and *precision manufacturing*, announced by *Piyush Goyal*. 
- He emphasized India's cost advantage in *research and innovation* and urged Indian industry to adopt forward-looking, globally competitive practices. 
- Goyal highlighted India's strengths—youthful workforce, rising *digital adoption*, and *STEM* talent—and initiatives like the $12 billion *RDI fund* and the *Semiconductor Mission*.

items.title: Govt reforms, manufacturing push lift Q2 growth to 8.2%
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- 8.2% GDP growth in Q2, fueled by *reforms* to boost **manufacturing** and ease of doing business.
- **Manufacturing output** rose **9.1%** and exports grew despite global uncertainties, underscoring reform impact.
- India remains the world's fastest-growing major economy, aided by GST cuts and festive-season demand.

items.title: Defence startups need orders, not gov VC funds
items.summary:
- Defence Secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh said that funding for defence startups depends on an *order book*, with assured orders and speedy *procurement* attracting private investment, not a government‑backed VC fund.
- He added that a sovereign VC fund might be supplementary; more important are *orders*, quick contract signings, and domestic procurement to lure capital into defence manufacturing.
- Citing targets of ₹3 lakh crore in defence manufacturing and ₹50,000 crore in exports, he urged using existing budget, accelerating contracting, and identifying capable Indian firms.

items.title: Senvion India expands wind turbine manufacturing capacity, eyes global exports
Indian firms like L&T, ITC step up green goals with bigger renewable, recycling, and net-zero commitments
India in talks with 50 nations for trade pacts
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- India is in talks with about 50 countries for trade pacts across 14 groups, said *Piyush Goyal*.
- A **Canada CEPA** is on the table with talks set to start next week, and GCC partners are keen to engage.
- India already has FTAs with **Australia, UAE, UK and EFTA**, and is reviewing others while pursuing deals with the US, NZ, Korea and ASEAN.

items.title: Tega to acquire Molycop; ₹1,713-crore fundraise
items.summary:
- Tega Industries signs a definitive agreement with funds managed by **American Industrial Partners** to acquire **Molycop**, in partnership with **Apollo Global Management**.
- It completes a **₹1,713-crore** preferential equity fundraise at an enterprise value of about **$1.45 billion**.
- Post‑acquisition, **Tega** will operate **26 manufacturing facilities** worldwide, expanding its global reach toward a leading, **innovation‑driven** mining solutions group.

items.title: Adani Group plans to raise ₹90,000 crore via debt in FY27
items.summary:
- The group plans to raise about **₹90,000 crore** in debt for *FY27* as part of a ₹1.57 lakh crore capex, with ~55% from domestic banks/DCM and ~45% from global sources (intl banks ~25%; global DCM ~18–20%).
- Financing supports **airports**, **energy transitions**, **ports**, **data centres** and **industrial infra** to sustain growth across markets.
- Quarterly target **₹40,000 crore**; year so far **₹80,000 crore**, with **₹44,000 crore** more expected; plan uses both debt and equity.

items.title: ₹9,000 crore defence deals with US in Nov: For maintenance of MH 60R helicopters, supply of Excalibur & Javelin
Why is India considering nuclear privatisation? PM Modi’s big shift explained
Airbus issues major A320 recall, threatening global flight disruption
India seals ₹7,995 crore MH-60R fleet support deal
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- **₹7,995 crore** sustainment package signed under the US *Foreign Military Sales* for five years for the Indian Navy's MH-60R fleet.
- The package includes spares, training, maintenance, and in-country facilities, boosting self-reliance under *Aatmanirbhar Bharat* and MSMEs.
- The LOAs under the US FMS program enhance operational availability and anti-submarine capability, with the first three MH-60Rs delivered in 2021.
